abstract: Many Cuban nationals who have lived in United States for decades and have been convicted of crimes here fear they will be deported now that relations between countries are normalizing; as American officials meet with Cubans to discuss migration issues, some Cubans who had chose not to fight deportation orders in the past worry that decision could haunt them.
lead_paragraph: A longstanding policy of permitting Cubans with criminal convictions to remain in the United States is suddenly on shakier ground.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, and Kristin Hussey from Greenwich, Conn.
byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and KRISTIN HUSSEY

snippet: A longstanding policy of permitting Cubans with criminal convictions to remain in the United States is suddenly on shakier ground.

headline.main: Cubans Convicted in the U.S. Face New Fears of Deportation
headline.print_headline: Cubans Convicted in the U.S. Face New Fears of Deportation
